summary: This is a stipulated motion and court order from the civil case US Virgin Islands v. JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. It establishes a protocol for the Epstein Estate to review video and photographic materials ('Epstein Media') for responsiveness to subpoenas and to screen for potential child sex abuse material (CSAM) before production to parties in the litigation.

persons.name: Jane Doe 1
persons.context: Plaintiff who alleges she was a victim of coerced commercial sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators; issued subpoenas to the Epstein Estate for video and photographic materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: Deceased individual whose estate is in possession of media materials being subpoenaed; alleged to have been involved in sex trafficking.

connections.description: Jane Doe 1 alleges she was a victim of coerced commercial sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein.
JPMorgan Chase is the third-party plaintiff suing James Edward Staley as a third-party defendant in this litigation.
Jane Doe 1 has issued subpoenas to the Epstein Estate for materials, and the Estate is reviewing materials for production.

events.title: Estate Notifies of Located Materials
events.description: Counsel for the Epstein Estate notified counsel for Jane Doe 1 that it had located materials within the Epstein Media that may be responsive to her subpoenas and expressed concern some might contain CSAM.

events.title: Filing of Stipulated Motion
events.description: Parties filed a stipulated motion for court approval of a protocol to review Epstein Media for CSAM and for disclosure of responsive materials.
personsInvolved: Government of the United States Virgin Islands

locations: United States District Court for the Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The Epstein Estate possesses a collection of video and photographic materials ('Epstein Media') that is subject to subpoenas in civil litigation.
The Estate expressed concern that some of the Epstein Media might contain child sex abuse material (CSAM), prompting the need for a court-approved review protocol.
The established protocol requires the Estate to review materials, stop and notify the FBI if potential CSAM is observed, and only produce non-CSAM responsive media to parties.
Jane Doe 1 alleges she was a victim of coerced commercial sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirators.
The document is part of the case Government of the United States Virgin Islands v. JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A., which also involves third-party claims against James Edward Staley.
